list_definition.definition: over, finished or ended, of an earlier time than the present

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The time for discussion is past.

list_definition.definition: (of the tense of a verb) indicating action in the past

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: In ‘He did it’, the verb is in the past tense.

list_definition.definition: up to and beyond (a particular place, person etc)
a person’s earlier life or career, especially if secret or not respectable

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He never spoke about his past.

list_ex_of_english: I say that these are two conditions which would have to be fulfilled in any envisaged eschatological redemption of the past.
Then yesterday, and, indeed, any day in the past year, cannot be set in correspondence with a past year beginning subsequently to that day.
We looked upon these things as belonging to one of the worst and painful pasts which would never recur.
Otherwise, our knowledge will continue to have little or no control over the process of communicating mainstream messages about either reconstructed or fictional ancient pasts.
The pasts we are concerned with appear to be linked to processes of change, as observed in material culture, that are prior to the temporal frameworks we assign to them.
In particular, they form their past tense forms in untypical ways, and they distinguish two types of onset.
However, this is arguably not normally the situation in relation to currently contested pasts.
Unlike ' x-class ' students, these respondents did not need to renounce or completely repress their pasts.
